title: Angle of motion after inelastic collision

content.description: Cart <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is traveling east when it collides with cart <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, which is traveling north. Cart <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> has a mass of <math alttext="3.05 kilograms" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.05</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, and cart <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> has a mass of <math alttext="2.10 kilograms" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. The two carts travel together as a single object on a horizontal surface at an angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> relative to due east, as shown above.
content.question: In one trial, the initial speed of cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="2.5 meters per second " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mrow><mrow><mtext> m</mtext></mrow><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and the initial speed of cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="1.5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mrow><mrow><mtext> m</mtext></mrow><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> relative to east that the carts travel after the collision is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
